title: Lib Dem staffer says sorry after ‘gaslighting’ black MP Dawn Butler in race row
text:
Steve Wilson’s wife was caught up in a high profile race row earlier this year, which MP Dawn Butler has picked up on (Picture: Steve Wilson/Twitter; PA)

A Liberal Democrat MP’s husband has apologised to a black MP for suggesting she lied in a Metro.co.uk column about her experiences of racism.

Steve Wilson – who is also chief of staff for Angela Smith – who described people of colour as having a ‘funny tinge’ – suggested Labour’s Dawn Butler had made up being mistaken for a cleaner when using a lift in Parliament.

Ms Butler has called on Lib Dem leader Jo Swinson to investigate the ‘deeply disturbing trolling’ and urged her to take ‘swift disciplinary action’. She said the comments constituted ‘totally unacceptable gaslighting’.

Ms Butler, who is the Shadow Secretary of State for Women and Equalities, added that the tweet, combined with Mrs Smith’s ‘funny tinge’ comments, meant the Lib Dems should ‘make an assessment of whether there is a particular problem’ in the MP’s office and if ‘diversity training for Mrs Smith and her staff’ is necessary.

Mrs Smith, who defected from Labour to Change UK before joining the Lib Dems, quickly apologised for the ‘funny tinge’ comments, saying she misspoke ‘really, really badly’ and was tired.

Mr Wilson is married to Angela Smith and is also her chief of staff (Picture: Steve Wilson/Twitter)

Dawn Butler called Mr Wilson’s response ‘deeply disturbing trolling’ (Picture: PA)

Her husband’s tweet and account appear to have been deleted.

However, according to Ms Butler, Mr Wilson responded to her article earlier this month on Twitter by writing: ‘This is just not true.

‘I’ve worked in parliament for 15 years and the lifts have always been for use of everyone…’ suggesting stories like this ‘don’t do anyone justice and anyone propagating them should stop it.’

In a letter to Ms Swinson, Ms Butler wrote: ‘White men denying our lived experiences and accusing those of us who do speak out about it of lying, not only legitimises, but it actively promotes racism.’

Before the letter was published on Twitter, Mr Wilson, Angela Smith’s Chief of Staff, issued a full apology, telling Metro.co.uk: ‘I apologise for the offence I have caused.

The letter sent by Shadow Secretary of State for Women and Equalities Dawn Butler to Lib Dem leader Jo Swinson (Picture: Dawn Butler/Twitter)

‘We must all take responsibility for condemning racism and prejudice in all its forms, in order to stamp it out from our society.’

In her initial article, Ms Butler said that on her first day in Parliament she was ‘shocked and stunned’ to be told that ‘this lift isn’t for cleaners.’

Discussing Black History Month and criticising the hostile environment policy, Ms Butler continued: ‘I challenge people to read the UN report on the contemporary forms of racism, racial discrimination, xenophobia and related intolerance as it consolidated my thinking and it covered everything and was particularly damning about the hostile environment.

‘Instead of our country moving forwards on equality, we are moving back at break neck speed because sadly we now have – and it gives me no pleasure in saying this – a racist in Number 10.’

The letter calls for disciplinary action (Picture: Dawn Butler/Twitter)

Ms Swinson did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

A Labour Party source said: ‘This doesn’t come as a huge surprise from the husband of Angela “funny tinge” Smith.

‘The Lib Dems should immediately suspend him and fully investigate but given they’ve welcomed with open arms MPs who oppose LGBT legislation and MPs who make racist remarks, we won’t hold our breath for them to take action.’

description: Angela Smith's wife Steve Wilson has been forced to apologise to Labour MP Dawn Butler after suggesting she lied about discrimination in Parliament.
